IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: SATISFY NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY BY PROVIDING HOUSING, HEALTHCARE, & FINANCIAL SECURITY
IRS990.MissionDescription: Westminster Village North, a nonprofit continuing care community is committed to excellence in residential and health care services for senior adults in a secure home environment that enhances their mental, physical and spiritual well-being.
IRS990.Description: To provide housing, healthcare, and financial security pursuant to rev. Rul. 72-124 satisfying the three special needs of the elderly.Housing:The village provides residential facilities that are specifically designed to meet the needs of the elderly; constructed with fire-resistant material; bathrooms equipped with grab-bars; equipped with ramps and elevators for wheelchair use; carpeted corridors and handrails; maintenance free living; on-site commercial services (bank, store, beauty salon); chapel; emergency call system and intercom.

Activity2.Description: Financial security:Westminster village provides continuing care to the village residents regardless of their ability to pay. Although reimbursement for services rendered is critical to the operation and stability of the facility, not all residents possess the necessary financial resources to maintain their living expenses. Services were also provided to Medicare patients at reimbursement rates below cost. During The current fiscal year $633,317 of charity care was provided with $474,749 related to Medicaid losses and $158,468 related to direct charity care write offs. The village provides charity care to those residents who have exhausted their resources. This equates to

Activity3.Description: Healthcare:The village provides for the physical and mental well-being of their residents; health center on premises; skilled & intermediate nursing care with 24 hour professional staffing; scheduled physician outpatient services; scheduled speech and physical therapy; prescription services; exercise classes and a wide range of social and recreational activities.

ActivityOther.Description: Social Accountability:In addition, as a not-for-profit other programs and services for the benefit of the community are provided, such as meals on wheels daily deliveries, health promotions and education seminars, internships and site visits for health care students and other volunteer activities. We also encourage our associates to take an active part in the community we serve.Westminster Village North, Inc. opens its doors to both the residents and the community we serve by providing personnel, speakers, and space, if needed to/for the following organizations and events.Allisonville United Christian Presentation and DinnerAlzheimer's Association DonationsBeans & Rice Project for Lawrence Food PantryBenjamin Harrison Master Gardeners LuncheonBrookville Road Church Mimers (on-site)Castleton United Methodist Church (on-site)Cat Companions for Seniors PresentationsChristmas Hobby ShowCivic Theatre Resident AttendanceCivil Air PatrolClifty Falls Park TripCommunity Hospice PresentationsCommunity Life Line Christian Church (on-site)Coupon Cutters for the MilitaryDaisy Girl Scouts #98Dance KaleidoscopeDevourDowntown.orgFood Drive for Outlook Christian ChurchGrand Opening, Mary Newill Therapy CenterGrandfather/Granddaughter BrunchGreat Decisions Series at Butler UniversityHarvest Church, McCordsvilleHoliday BazaarHorizon Church (on-site)Indiana Actors' TheatreIndiana Historical SocietyIndiana State MuseumIndiana State ParksIndiana State UniversityIndianapolis Museum of Art Resident AttendanceIndianapolis Symphony Orchestra Resident AttendanceIndianapolis ZooIrvington Presbyterian Church Home TourIrvington Presbyterian Church PresentationsKiwanis Doll ProjectKiwanis Meetings on siteKiwanis Presentation - OtherAssets.Description: Escrow & Debt Service Funds - held by trustee

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Temporarily restricted net assets are available for certain operational uses including charity care.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: Provides scholarships for employees furthering their education.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The assistance is provided for tuition reimbursement which is monitored by the Director of Human Resources. THe Director of HR reviews the grades and tuition expenses incurred by an employee and verfies the individual received a C or higher letter grade and has been working for the organization for one year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization is organized as a nonprofit corporation with a board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 was discussed at the Finance Committee Meeting held in January 2011. It is the intent for the CFO to prepare a summary of the 990 for the Board Members. The Board will then review the Summary at the February 2011 meeting and copies will be available for review.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each Year the Board members complete a "Conflict of Interest" Form.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Compensation Committee of the Board as well as the Fianance Committee review the Executive Director's compensation each year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization does not make the governing documents, conflict of interest policy, or financial statements available to the public.
The Board of Directors assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit of the financial statements and no processes have changed from prior year.
